newsitem.title: GERMANY: German winter crops need more rain.
newsitem.headline: German winter crops need more rain.

text.p: German winter rapeseed and grain crops are developing normally but precipitation in December and January has been below average, the DWD meteorological office said.
"Crops are dormant and generally doing well, but we are keeping an eye on low soil moisture levels...the crops could do with more rain," a DWD source said.
The snow cover built up in recent weeks had not been high so that the current thaw would not bring enough moisture to offset the lack of rainfall, he added.
Damage from recent night frosts, which is not believed to be serious, should also become evident when the snow melts.
DWD forecast cold air, some rain in the West and North, and maximum day temperatures of two to four degrees for the next seven days.
